paragraph.content: before or on the day, if any, on which the relevant person is so surrendered, the relevant arrangements cease, by virtue of an order under section 3(1) coming into operation in respect of the relevant place, to be arrangements pursuant to which any new proceedings may be instituted for the surrender of a person to Hong Kong from the relevant place,

subsection.continued: then, notwithstanding any other law of Hong Kong, for the purposes of the treatment to be accorded the relevant person on and after the day, if any, on which he is so surrendered, the provisions of the prescribed arrangements the subject of the order referred to in paragraph (b), and of this Ordinance, applicable to the surrender of a person to Hong Kong from the relevant place pursuant to those arrangements shall apply in relation to the relevant person and, accordingly, for those purposes those provisions shall be read and have effect with such modifications as may be necessary.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the operation of subsection (3), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person (the relevant person) has been surrendered to Hong Kong from a place outside Hong Kong (the relevant place) pursuant to arrangements for such surrender (the relevant arrangements) which are not prescribed arrangements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on or after the day on which the relevant person is so surrendered, the relevant arrangements cease, by whatever means (other than by virtue of an order under section 3(1) coming into operation in respect of the relevant place), to be arrangements pursuant to which any new proceedings may be instituted for the surrender of a person to Hong Kong from the relevant place,

subsection.continued: then, notwithstanding any other law of Hong Kong, for the purposes of the treatment to be accorded the relevant person on and after the day on which the cesser referred to paragraph (b) comes into operation, the provisions of this Ordinance applicable to the surrender of a person to Hong Kong from a prescribed place pursuant to prescribed arrangements shall apply in relation to the relevant person and, accordingly, for those purposes—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: those provisions shall be read and have effect with such modifications as may be necessary; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (i), the relevant place and the relevant arrangements shall be deemed to be a prescribed place and prescribed arrangements respectively.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the operation of subsection (4), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person (the relevant person) has been surrendered to Hong Kong from a place outside Hong Kong (the relevant place) pursuant to arrangements for such surrender (the relevant arrangements) which are not prescribed arrangements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on or after the day on which the relevant person is so surrendered, the relevant arrangements cease, by virtue of an order under section 3(1) coming into operation in respect of the relevant place, to be arrangements pursuant to which any new proceedings may be instituted for the surrender of a person to Hong Kong from the relevant place,

subsection.continued: then, notwithstanding any other law of Hong Kong, for the purposes of the treatment to be accorded the relevant person on and after the day on which the cesser referred to paragraph (b) comes into operation, the provisions of the prescribed arrangements the subject of the order referred to in that paragraph, and of this Ordinance, applicable to the surrender of a person to Hong Kong from the relevant place pursuant to the prescribed arrangements shall apply in relation to the relevant person and, accordingly, for those purposes those provisions shall be read and have effect with such modifications as may be necessary.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, proceedings have been instituted for the surrender of a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: from Hong Kong to a place outside Hong Kong, where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a warrant (whether provisional or otherwise) has been issued in Hong Kong for the arrest of the person in relation to the offence for which such surrender is sought; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an authorization, howsoever described, has been given for the person to be dealt with under the provisions of a relevant enactment relating to such surrender in respect of the offence for which such surrender is sought;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to Hong Kong from a place outside Hong Kong, where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a warrant (whether provisional or otherwise) has been issued in that place for the arrest of the person in relation to the offence for which such surrender is sought; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an authorization, howsoever described, has been given for the person to be dealt with under the provisions of the law of that place relating to such surrender in respect of the offence for which such surrender is sought.

subsection.def: In this section, relevant enactment (有關成文法則) means an enactment which is, or was, a relevant enactment within the meaning of section 3(16).

section.name: s1
section.content: Murder or manslaughter, including criminal negligence causing death; culpable homicide; assault with intent to commit murder.

section.name: s2
section.content: Aiding, abetting, counselling or procuring suicide.

section.name: s3
section.content: Maliciously wounding; maiming; inflicting grievous or actual bodily harm; assault occasioning actual bodily harm; threats to kill; intentional or reckless endangering of life whether by means of a weapon, a dangerous substance or otherwise; offences relating to unlawful wounding or injuring.

section.name: s4
section.content: Offences of a sexual nature including rape; sexual assault; indecent assault; unlawful sexual acts on children; statutory sexual offences.

section.name: s5
section.content: Gross indecency with a child, a mental defective or an unconscious person.

section.name: s6
section.content: Kidnapping; abduction; false imprisonment; unlawful confinement; dealing or trafficking in slaves or other persons; taking a hostage.

section.name: s7
section.content: Criminal intimidation.

section.name: s8
section.content: Offences against the law relating to dangerous drugs including narcotics, psychotropic substances, precursors and essential chemicals used in the illegal manufacture of narcotics and psychotropic substances; offences relating to the proceeds of drug trafficking.

section.name: s9
section.content: Obtaining property or pecuniary advantage by deception; theft; robbery; burglary (including breaking and entering); embezzlement; blackmail; extortion; unlawful handling or receiving of property; false accounting; any other offence in respect of property or fiscal matters involving fraud; any offence against the law relating to unlawful deprivation of property.

section.name: s10
section.content: Offences against bankruptcy law or insolvency law.

section.name: s11
section.content: Offences against the law relating to companies including offences committed by officers, directors and promoters.

section.name: s12
section.content: Offences relating to securities and futures trading.

section.name: s13
section.content: Offences relating to counterfeiting; offences against the law relating to forgery or uttering what is forged.

section.name: s14
section.content: Offences against the law relating to protection of intellectual property, copyrights, patents or trademarks.

section.name: s15
section.content: Offences against the law relating to bribery, corruption, secret commissions and breach of trust.

section.name: s16
section.content: Perjury and subornation of perjury.

section.name: s17
section.content: Offence relating to the perversion or obstruction of the course of justice.

section.name: s18
section.content: Arson; criminal damage or mischief including mischief in relation to computer data.

section.name: s19
section.content: Offences against the law relating to firearms.

section.name: s20
section.content: Offences against the law relating to explosives.

section.name: s21
section.content: Offences against the law relating to environmental pollution or protection of public health.

section.name: s22
section.content: Mutiny or any mutinous act committed on board a vessel at sea.

section.name: s23
section.content: Piracy involving ships or aircraft.

section.name: s24
section.content: Unlawful seizure or exercise of control of an aircraft or other means of transportation.

section.name: s25
section.content: Genocide or direct and public incitement to commit genocide.

section.name: s26
section.content: Facilitating or permitting the escape of a person from custody.

section.name: s27
section.content: Offences against the law relating to the control of exportation or importation of goods of any type, or the international transfer of funds.

section.name: s28
section.content: Smuggling; offences against the law relating to import and export of prohibited items, including historical and archaeological items.

section.name: s29
section.content: Immigration offences including fraudulent acquisition or use of a passport or visa.

section.name: s30
section.content: Arranging or facilitating for financial gain, the illegal entry of persons into a jurisdiction.

section.name: s31
section.content: Offences relating to gambling or lotteries.

section.name: s32
section.content: Offences relating to the unlawful termination of pregnancy.

section.name: s33
section.content: Stealing, abandoning, exposing or unlawfully detaining a child; any other offences involving the exploitation of children.

section.name: s34
section.content: Offences against the law relating to prostitution and premises kept for the purposes of prostitution.

section.name: s35
section.content: Offences involving the unlawful use of computers.

section.name: s36
section.content: Offences relating to fiscal matters, taxes or duties.

section.name: s37
section.content: Offences relating to unlawful escape from custody; mutiny in prison.

section.name: s38
section.content: Bigamy.

section.name: s39
section.content: Offences relating to women and girls.

section.name: s40
section.content: Offences against the law relating to false or misleading trade descriptions.

section.name: s41
section.content: Offences relating to the possession or laundering of proceeds obtained from the commission of any offence described in this Schedule.

section.name: s42
section.content: Impeding the arrest or prosecution of a person who has or is believed to have committed an offence described in this Schedule.

section.name: s43
section.content: Offences for which persons may be surrendered under multi-lateral international conventions; offences created as a result of decisions of international organizations.

section.name: s44
section.content: Conspiracy to commit fraud or to defraud.

section.name: s45
section.content: Conspiracy to commit, or any type of association to commit, any offence described in this Schedule.

section.name: s46
section.content: Aiding, abetting, counselling or procuring the commission of, inciting, being an accessory before or after the fact to, or attempting to commit an offence described in this Schedule.
